context.description: This component transfers given data to Google BigQuery.
This component performed the queries supported by Google BigQuery.
This component transfers the data provided by its preceding component to Google BigQuery.
This component creates a .txt or .csv file for the data of large size so that you can process it according to your needs before transferring it to Google BigQuery.
tCassandraClose is used to close an active connection to the Cassandra server.
tCassandraConnection allows you to define a connection to a Cassandra server to be reused by other Cassandra components.
tCassandraInput reads data from the specified Cassandra keyspace and sends data to the next component.
tCassandraOutput is used to output data into Cassandra.
Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tCassandraRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data).
This component closes a transaction.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tHBaseInput extracts columns corresponding to schema definition. Then it passes these columns to the next component via a Main row link.
tHBaseOutput writes columns of data into a given tHBase database.

The tHCatalogInput component reads data from the specified HCatalog managed database and sends data in the talend flow to the console or to a specified local file by connecting this component to a proper component.
The tHCatalogLoad component writes data into an established HCatalog managed table from an existing file in HDFS.
The tHCatalogOperation component offers a platform on which you can operate in HCatalog managed database/table/partition in HDFS.
The tHCatalogOutput component writes data into a HCatalog managed table using Talend data flow.
This component helps to control the quality of the data processed.
tHDFSConnection connects to a given HDFS so that the other Hadoop components can reuse the connection it creates to communicate with this HDFS.
tHDFSCopy moves files in HDFS with or without keeping the source.
tHDFSDelete deletes a file on a given HDFS.
This component checks the existence of a specific file in HDFS.
tHDFSGet connects to Hadoop distributed file system, helping to obtain large-scale files with optimized performance.
tHDFSInput extracts the data in a HDFS file for other components to process it.
tHDFSList retrieves a list of files or folders based on a filemask pattern and iterates on each unity.
tHDFSOnput writes data of interest into a file and creates this file on a given HDFS.
This component presents the properties of a file processed in HDFS.
tHDFSPut connects to Hadoop distributed file system to load large-scale files into it with optimized performance.
tHDFSRename renames files selected from a local directory towards a distant HDFS directory.
This component counts the number of rows in a file in HDFS.
This component closes connection to a Hive databases.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tHiveInput executes the select queries to extract the corresponding data and sends the data to the component that follows.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tHiveRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write your HiveQL statements easily.
This component closes a connection to the Mongo database.
This component allows you to create a connection to a Mongo database and reuse that connection in other components.
This component allows you to retrieve records from a collection in the Mongo database and transfer them to the following component for display or storage.
This component executes the action defined on the collection in the Mongo database.
This component allows you to execute the commands and functions of the Mongo database.
The tPigAggregate component adds one or more additional columns to the output of the grouped data to create data to be used by Pig.
tPigCode extends the functionalities of a Talend Job through using Pig scripts.
The tPigCross component uses CROSS operator to compute the Cartesian product.
The tPigDistinct component removes duplicate tuples in a relation.
This tPigFilterColumns component selects data or filters out data from a relation based on defined filter conditions.
This component is used to filter the input flow in a Pig chain based on conditions set on one or more columns.
The tPigJoin component is used to perform inner joins and outer joins of two files based on join keys to create data that will be used by Pig.
The tPigLoad component loads original input data to an output stream in just one single transaction, once the data has been validated.
The tPigSort component is used to sort relation based on one or more defined sort keys.
The tPigStoreResult component is used to store the result into defined data storage space.
tSqoopExport is used to define the arguments required by Sqoop for transferring data to a RDBMS.
tSqoopImport is used to define the arguments required by Sqoop for writing the data of your interest into HDFS.
tSqoopImportAllTables is used to define the arguments required by Sqoop for writing all of the tables of a database into HDFS.
Allows to create and manage documents in an Alfresco server.
This component deploys a specific Bonita process to a Bonita Runtime.
This component starts an instance for a specific process deployed in a Bonita Runtime engine.
Allows to extract data from a Centric CRM DB based on a query.
Allows to write data into a CentricCRM DB.
Opens an HL7 structured file and reads it row by row to split them up into fields then sends the fields as defined in the Schema to the next component, via a Row link.
This component writes an HL7 structured file according to the HL7 standards.
The tMarketoInput component allows you to retrieve data from a Marketo DB on a Web server.

The tMarketoListOperation component allows you to add/remove one or more leads to/from a list in the Marketo DB on a Web server. Also, you can verify the existence of one or more leads in a list in the Marketo DB.
The tMarketoOutput component allows you to write data into a Marketo DB on a Web server.
Allows to extract data from a Microsoft CRM DB based on conditions set on specific columns.
Allows to write data into a Microsoft CRM DB.
This component allows to extract data from a MicrosoftAX server based on a query.
This component allows to write data in a MicrosoftAX server.
This component allows you to extract data from OpenBravoERP database according to the conditions defined in specific columns.
This component writes data in an OpenbravoERP database.
This component extracts data from a given Sage X3 system.
This component writes data into a given Sage X3 system.
As a dedicated component, tSalesforceBulkExec gains performance while carrying out the intended data operations into your Salesforce.com.
The component enables connection to a Salesforce.
This component can collect the deleted data from a Salesforce object during a specific period of time.
This component retrieves the current date of the Salesforce server presented in a timestamp format.
This component can collect all updated data from a given Salesforce object during a specific period of time.
Allows to extract data from a Salesforce DB based on a query.
Allows to write data into a Salesforce DB.
Prepares the file to be processed by tSalesforceBulkExec for executions in Salesforce.com.
As a dedicated component, tSalesforceOutputBulkExec gains performance while carrying out the intended data operations into your Salesforce.com.
This component executes an SQL query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to your schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Row > Main connection.
Using a unique connection, this component commits a global transaction in one go instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
tSAPConnection allows to commit a whole Job data in one go to the SAP system as one transaction.
tSAPIDocInput allows you to extract IDoc data set that is used for asynchronous transactions between SAP systems or between a SAP system and another application..
tSAPIDocOutput allows you to upload IDoc data set in XML fomat to an SAP system.
tSAPInput allows to extract data from an SAP system at any level through calling RFC or BAPI functions.
Allows to write data into an SAP system.
tSAPRollback avoids to commit only a fragment of a transaction.
Allows you to extract data from a SugarCRM DB based on a query.
Allows you to write data into a SugarCRM DB.
Allows to extract data from a VtigerCRM DB.
Allows to write data from a VtigerCRM DB.
tBarChart generates a bar chart from the input data to ease technical analysis.
tDB2SCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tDB2SCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated DB2 SCD table.
tGreenplumSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tInformixSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension transformation needs, by regularly reading a data source and listing the modifications in an SCD dedicated table.
tIngresSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
This component allows you to use Jaspersoft's iReport to create a report in rich formats.

This component allows you to use Jaspersoft's iReport to create a report in rich formats. It offers a performance gain as it functions as a combination of an input component and a tJasperOutput component.
tLineChart generates a line chart from the input data to ease technical analysis.

tMondrianInput executes a multi-dimensional expression (MDX) query corresponding to the dataset structure and schema definition. Then it passes on the multidimensional dataset obtained to the next component via a Main row link.
tMSqlSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tMysqlSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tMysqlSCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated MySQL SCD table.
tOracleSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tOracleSCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated DB2 SCD table.

This component can be used along with tPaloOutputMulti. It checks if the elements from the input stream exist in the given cube, before writing them. It can also define a default value to be used for nonexistent elements.
This component allows other components involved in a process to share its connection to a Palo server for the duration of the process.
This component performs operations on a given Palo cube.
This component lists cube names, cube types, number of assigned dimensions, the number of filled cells from the given database.int
This component manages the databases inside a Palo server.
This component lists database names, database types, number of cubes, number of dimensions, database status and database id from a given Palo server.int
This component manages Palo dimensions, even elements inside a database

This component lists dimension names, dimension types, number of dimension elements, maximum dimension indent, maximum dimension depth, maximum dimension level, dimension id from a given Palo server.string
This component retrieves the stored or calculated values in combination with the element records out of a cube.
This component takes the input stream and writes it to a given Palo cube.
This component takes the input stream and writes it to a given Palo cube.
This component allows you to manage rules in a given cube.
This component lists all rules, formulas, comments, activation status, external IDs from a given cube.string
tParAccelSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tPostgresPlusSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tPostgresPlusSCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated PostgresPlus SCD table.
tPostgresqlSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tPostgresqlSCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated DB2 SCD table.
tSPSSInput addresses SPSS .sav data to write it for example in another file.
tSPSSOutput writes or appends data to an SPSS .sav file. It creates SPSS files on the fly and overwrites existing ones.
tSPSSProperties allows you to obtain information about the main properties of a defined SPSS .sav file.

tSPSSStructure addresses variables inside .sav files. You can use this component in combination with tFileList to gather information about existing *.sav files to further analyze or check the findings.
tSybaseSCD addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs, reading regularly a source of data and logging the changes into a dedicated SCD table
tSybaselSCDELT addresses Slowly Changing Dimension needs through SQL queries (server-side processing mode), and logs the changes into a dedicated Sybase SCD table.
Close a transaction.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tAmazonMysqlInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tAmazonMysqlOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
Avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tAmazonMysqlRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.
Close a transaction.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tAmazonOracleInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tAmazonOracleOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
Avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tAmazonOracleRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.
tGroovy broadens the functionality if the Talend Job, using the Groovy language which is a simplified Java syntax.
tGroovyFile broadens the functionaility of Talend Jobs using the Groovy language which is a simplified Java syntax.
tJava makes it possible to extend the functionalities of a Talend Job through using Java commands.
tJavaFlex lets you add Java code to the Start/Main/End code sections of this component itself.
tJavaRow allows you to broaden the functionality of Talend Jobs, using the Java language.
tLibraryLoad allows you to load useable Java libraries in a Job.

tSetDynamicSchema is used to create a dynamic schema to allow components that are unable to guess the structure of the data being handled based on field separators, such as tFileInputPositional and tFileOutputPositional, to retrieve data from unknown columns.
tSetGlobalVar facilitates the process of defining global variables.
Providing a unique ID helps improving the quality of processed data.
Helps ensuring the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
tFindRegexlibExpressions returns a data set holding information about all of the regular expressions that match the request sent to the web server. Then you can keep this information
Helps ensuring the data quality of first names against a reference index in order to standardize data.
Helps ensuring the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
Helps ensuring the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
Helps ensuring the data quality of any source data.

tGenKey generates a functional key from the input columns, by applying different types of algorithms on each column and grouping the computed results in one key. It outputs this key together with the input columns.

This component generates a functional key from the input columns, by applying different types of algorithms on each column and grouping the computed results in one key. It outputs this key together with the input columns.
tGoogleAddressRow allows you to converts human-readable addresses into geographic coordinates and other geographic information
tGoogleGeocoder allows you to converts human-readable addresses into geographic coordinates.
tGoogleMapLoopup allows you to obtain detailed geographic information using geographic coordinates and address information.
Helps to return a value based on a Join relation.
tFindRegexlibExpressionsreturns a dataset holding information about the N most recent regular expressions added to the library and that match the query at http://regexlib.com.

tLaunchDQReports can communicate with Talend Data Quality in order to launch an analysis and save the results of the analysis in a database. Using this component, you can launch the generation of all types of reports: pdf, XML, or HTML.
This component helps ensuring the data quality of any source data.
This component helps ensure the quality of any source data of large volume.
tMelissaDataAddress verifies that an address is a properly formatted address and corrects any formatting or spelling errors in each row.

tMultiPatternCheck can give two output flows: Matching Data and Non-Matching Data. The first collects all data that match a given pattern, and the second collects all data that do not match a given pattern. You can then implement any required corrections.
tMySQLInvalidRows allows you to extract DB rows that do not match a given data quality pattern or rule. You can then implement any required correction.
tMySQLValidRows allows you to extract DB rows that match a given data quality pattern.
tOracleInvalidRows allows you to extract DB rows that do not match a given data quality pattern, you can then implement any required correction.
tOracleValidRows allows you to extract DB rows that match a given data quality pattern.

tPatternCheck can give two output flows: Matching Data and Non-Matching Data. The first collects all data that match a given pattern, and the second collects all data that do not match a given pattern. You can then implement any required corrections.
tPatternExtract allows to output all data that match a given pattern. You can then implement any required operation on the extracted data.
tPostgresqlInvalidRows allows you to extract DB rows that do not match a given data quality pattern, you can then implement any required correction.
tPostgresqlValidRows allows you to extract DB rows that match a given data quality pattern.

tQASAddressIncomplete can give two output flows: Incomplete and Reject. Incomplete collects all addresses that match to a partially-complete address in the QuickAddress data. Reject collects all addresses that match to several possible results or do not match to deliverable results in the QuickAddress data.

tQASAddressRow corrects any formatting or spelling errors and gives the verification status for each row since the address may not always have enough information to be matched to a single deliverable result in the QuickAddress data.
tQASAddressUnknown can give one output flow: Unknown that collects all addresses that do not match to deliverable results in the QuickAddress data.

tQASAddressVerified can give three output flows: Verified, Interaction required, and Reject. Verified collects all addresses matched to a single deliverable address in the QuickAddress data. Interaction required collects all addresses that matched to a single deliverable address in the QuickAddress data, however user interaction is still recommended to confirm that it is the correct address. Reject collects all addresses that do not match to deliverable results in the QuickAddress data.

tQASBatchAddressRow corrects any formatting or spelling errors, adds missing data and gives the verification status for each row since the address may not always have enough information to be matched to a single deliverable result in the DLL data.
Helps ensuring the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
Helps to cleanse all files before further processing.
tRuleSurvivorship creates the single representation of an entity according to business rules. It helps to create a master copy of data for MDM.
Helps to ensure the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
This component standardizes phone numbers according to given formats.
tStandardizeRow normalizes the incoming data in a separate XML data flow. This allows you to separate, even standardize if need be, the rule-compliant data from the non-compliant data.
tStem enables to standardize data in columns before matching this data.
tSurviveFields centralizes data from various and heterogeneous sources. It helps to create a master copy of data for MDM.
tSynonymOutput creates synonym indexes that some components like tStandardizeRow or tSynonymSearch can refer to when processing data.
tSynonymSearch searches a given index for the reference entries matching the data you input.

tThresholdViolationAlert communicates with the report database that stores the analysis results. It scans the report database looking for the thresholds that are violated in the column analyses in the selected report. You can then use it with other components in the job, for example tSendMail, to alert to any threshold violations regarding the thresholds set on indicators used in the column analyses.
Ensures data quality of input or output flow in a Job.

tUniservBTGeneric sends the data to the DQ Batch Suite and starts the specified DQ Batch Suite job. When the job execution is finished, the results are returned to the Data Quality Service Hub Studio for further processing.
tUniservRTConvertName provides the basis for a uniform structuring and population of person and company names in the database as well as the personalized salutation.
tUniservRTMailBulk prepares the index pool for duplicate search.
tUniservRTMailOutput keeps the index pool synchronized.
tUniservRTMailSearch searches for duplicate values and adds additional data to each record.
tUniservRTPost helps to improve the addresses quality, which is extremely important for CRM and e-business as it is directly related to postage and advertising costs.
As a dedicated component, tAccessBulkExec offers gains in performance when carrying out Insert operations in an Access database.
tAccessClose is used to disconnect one connection to Access so as to release occupied resources.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tAccessInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined statement which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Row > Main connection.
tAccessOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
tAccessOutputBulk prepares the file which contains the data used to feed the Access database.
As a dedicated component, it improves performance during Insert operations in an Access database.
Avoids involuntary commitment of part of a transaction.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tAccessRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.

tAS400CDC addresses data extraction and transportation needs. tAS400CDC only extracts the changes carried out on the source operational data and makes them available to the target system(s) using database CDC views.
Close a transaction.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tAS400SInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined statement which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tAS400LastInsertId obtains the primary key value of the record that was last inserted in an AS400 table by a user.
tAS400Output executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
Avoids involuntary commitment of part of a transaction.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tAS400Row acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.
As a dedicated component, tDB2BulkExec allows gains in performance during Insert operations to a DB2 database.

tDB2CDC addresses data extraction and transportation needs. tDB2CDC only extracts the changes done to the source operational data and makes them available to the target system(s) using database CDC views.
Close a transaction.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tDB2Input executes a DB query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tDB2Output executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
Avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tDB2Row acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.
tDB2SP offers a convenient way to centralize multiple or complex queries in a database and call them easily.
tInformixBulkExec is a dedicated component which improves performance during Insert operations in Informix databases.
This component closes connection to Informix databases.
Using a single connection, make a global commit just once instead of commiting every row or batch of rows separately. This improves performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tInformixInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tInformixOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the Job.
Prepares the file to be used as a parmameter in the INSERT query used to feed Informix databases.
tInformixOutputBulkExec is a dedicated componant which improves performance during Insert operations in Informix databases.
This component prevents involuntary transaction commits.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tInformixRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.
tInformixSP allows you to centralise multiple and complex queries in a database and enables you to call them more easily.
As a dedicated component, tMSSqlBulkExec offers gains in performance while carrying out the Insert operations to a MSSql database

tMSSqlCDC addresses data extraction and transportation needs. tMSSqlCDC only extracts the changes made to the source operational data and makes them available to the target system(s) using database CDC views.
Lists all column names of a given MSSql table.

This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.

tMSSqlLastInsertId enables you to retrieve the last primary keys added by a user to a MSSql table.
tMSSqlOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the job.
Prepares the file to be used as parameter in the INSERT query to feed the MSSql database.
As a dedicated component, it allows gains in performance during Insert operations to a MSSql database.
Avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.

tMSSqlSP offers a convenient way to centralize multiple or complex queries in a database and call them easily.
Lists the names of a given set of MSSql tables using a select statement based on a Where clause.

Lists the names of a given set of Mysql tables using a select statement based on a Where clause.
As a dedicated component, it allows gains in performance during operations performed on data of an Oracle database.

This component lists the names of specified Oracle tables using a SELECT statement based on a WHERE clause.

Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tSybaseInput executes a DB query with a strictly defined order which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
As a dedicated component, it allows gains in performance during Insert operations to a Sybase IQ database.
As a dedicated component, it allows gains in performance during Insert operations to a Sybase IQ database.
tSybaseOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the job.
Prepares the file to be used as parameter in the INSERT query to feed the Sybase database.
As a dedicated component, it allows gains in performance during Insert operations to a Sybase database.
This component avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.

Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tSybaseRow acts on the actual DB structure or on the data (although without handling data). The SQLBuilder tool helps you write easily your SQL statements.

tTeradataFastLoad executes a database query according to a strict order which must be the same as the one in the schema. The retrieve list of fields is then transfered to the next component, using a connexion flow (Main row).

tTeradataFastLoadUtility executes a database query according to a strict order which must be the same as the one in the schema. The retrieve list of fields is then transfered to the next component, using a connexion flow (Main row).

tEXAInput executes queries in databases according to a strict order which must correspond exactly to that defined in the schema. The list of fields retrieved is then transmitted to the following component via a Main row link.
tEXAOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the table data, depending on the function of the input flow, from the preceding component.
Depending on the nature of the query and the database, tEXARow acts on the actual structure of the database, or indeed the data, although without modifying them.
Opens a connection to an eXist database in order that a transaction may be carried out.
tEXistDelete deletes specified resources from remote eXist databases.
tEXistGet downloads selected resources from a remote DB server to a defined local directory.
tEXistList lists the resources stored on a remote database server.
tEXistPut uploads specified files from a defined local directory to a remote DB server.
tEXistXQuery queries XML files located on remote databases and outputs the results to an XML file stored locally.
tEXistXUpdate processes XML file records and updates the existing records on the DB server.

tLDAPAttributesInput executes an LDAP query based on the given filter and corresponding to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tLDAPClose is used to disconnect one connection to the LDAP Directory server so as to release occupied resources.
This component creates a connection to an LDAP Directory server. Then it can be invoked by other components that need to access the LDAP Directory server, e.g., tLDAPInput, tLDAPOutput, etc.
tLDAPInput executes an LDAP query based on the given filter and corresponding to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
tLDAPOutput executes an LDAP query based on the given filter and corresponding to the schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Main row link.
The tLDAPRenameEntry component rename ones or more entries in a specific LDAP directory.

tMaxDBOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the job.

tSasOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the incoming flow from the preceding component in the Job.

Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component allows you to commit all of the Job data to an output database in just a single transaction, once the data has been validated.
tSQLiteInput executes a DB query with a defined command which must correspond to the schema definition. Then it passes on rows to the next component via a Main row link.
tSQLiteOutput executes the action defined on the table and/or on the data contained in the table, based on the flow incoming from the preceding component in the job.
Avoids to commit part of a transaction involuntarily.
A prepared statement uses the input flow to replace the placeholders with the values for each parameters defined. This component can be very useful for updates.
tDotNETInstantiate invokes the constructor of a .NET object that is intended for later reuse.
tDotNETRow helps you facilitate data transform by utilizing custom or built-in .NET classes.
Helps to provide a set of matrix based on values or calculations.
Helps to filter data by reorganizing, deleting or adding columns based on the source table and to filter the given data source using the filter conditions.

tCombinedSQLInput extracts fields from a database table based on its schema definition. Then it passes on the field list to the next component via a Combine row link. The schema of tCombinedSQLInput can be different from that of the source database table but must correspond to it in terms of the column order.
tCombinedSQLOutput inserts records from the incoming flow to an existing database table.
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Greenplum database
This component helps to replicate the schema, which the tELTHiveMap component that follows will use, of the input Hive table.
This component helps to graphically build the Hive QL statement in order to transform data.
This component works alongside tELTHiveMap to write data into the Hive table.
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the JDBC database
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the MSSql database
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Mysql database

Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Netezza database
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Mysql database.
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Postgresql database
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required, for Insert statements which can be complex.

Uses the tables provided as input to feed the parameters required to execute the SQL statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between a table and its aliases
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement in the Mysql database
Allows you to add as many Input tables as required for the most complicated Insert statement.
Uses the tables provided as input, to feed the parameter in the built statement. The statement can include inner or outer joins to be implemented between tables or between one table and its aliases.
Executes the SQL Insert, Update and Delete statement to the Teradata database
Helps to provide a set of matrix based on values or calculations.
Using a single connection, this component commits a global action in one go instead of doing so for every row or every batch of rows, separately. This provides a gain in performance.
Helps homogenize schemas by reorganizing, deleting or adding new columns.
Helps to set row filters for any given data source, based on a WHERE clause.
This component is used to merge data into a database table directly on the DBMS by creating and executing a MERGE statement.
To avoid committing transactions accidentally.
Invokes a Method through a Web service.
Acts as Fault message of the Web Service response at the end of a Talend Job cycle.
Waits for a request message from a consumer and passes it to the next component.
Acts as a service provider response builder at the end of each Talend Job cycle.
The tRESTClient component is used to interact with RESTful Web service providers by sending HTTP and HTTPS requests using CXF (JAX-RS).
This component allows you to receive GET/POST/PUT/DELETE requests from the clients on the server end.
This component allows you to return a specific HTTP status code to the client end as a response to the HTTP request.
tRouteFault allows you to send messages from a Job to a Route and mark the message as fault.
tRouteInput allows you to accept messages from a Route.
tRouteOutput allows you to send messages from a Job to a Route.
tApachLogInput helps to effectively manage the Apache HTTP Server,. It is necessary to get feedback about the activity and performance of the server as well as any problems that may be occurring.
tCreateTemporaryFile helps to create a temporary file and puts it in a defined directory. This component allows you to either keep the temporary file or delete it after Job execution.
tChangeFileEncoding transforms the character encoding of a given file and generates a new file with the transformed character encoding.
This component zips one or several files for processing.
Helps at controlling the data quality of files being processed.
Helps to streamline processes by automating recurrent and tedious tasks such as copy.
Helps to streamline processes by automating recurrent and tedious tasks such as delete.
tFileExists helps to streamline processes by automating recurrent and tedious tasks such as checking if a file exists.
This component opens a file and reads it row by row, in order to divide it in fields and to send these fields to the next component, as defined in the schema, through a Row connection.

tFileInputEBCDIC opens a file and reads it in order to separate the data, based on the file structure description (schemas), and to send the file data and metadata to the next Job component(s), via a Row > Main connection.

tFileInputExcel opens a file and reads it row by row to split data up into fields using regular expressions. Then sends fields as defined in the schema to the next component in the Job via a Row link.
tFileInputFullRow opens a file and reads it row by row and sends complete rows as defined in the Schema to the next Job component, via a Row link.
tFileInputJSON extracts JSON data from a file according to the JSONPath query, then transferring the flat data to a file, a database table, etc.
tFileInputLDIF opens a file, reads it row by row, et gives the full rows to the next component as defined in the schema, using a Row connection.
This component helps to extract standard key data from emails.
tFileInputMSDelimited opens a complex multi-structured file, reads its data structures (schemas) and then uses Row links to send fields as defined in the different schemas to the next Job components.

tFileInputMSPositional opens a complex multi-structured file, reads its data structures (schemas) and then uses Row links to send fields as defined in the different schemas to the next Job components.
tFileInputMSXML opens a complex multi-structured file, reads its data structures (schemas) and then uses Row links to send fields as defined in the different schemas to the next Job components.
This component opens a file and reads it row by row to split them up into fields then sends fields as defined in the schema to the next Job component, via a Row link.
tFileInputProperties opens a text file and reads it row by row then separates the fields according to the model key = value.
Opens a file and reads it row by row to split them up into fields using regular expressions. Then sends fields as defined in the Schema to the next Job component, via a Row link.
tFileList retrieves a set of files or folders based on a filemask pattern and iterates on each unity.
This component writes an ARFF file that holds data organized according to the defined schema.
This component writes a delimited file that holds data organized according to the defined schema.
This component writes an EBCDIC file with data extracted from files based on their schemas.
tFileOutputExcel writes an MS Excel file with separated data value according to a defined schema.
tFileOutputJSON receives data and rewrites it in a JSON structured data block in an output file.
tFileOutputLDIF writes or modifies a LDIF file with data separated in respective entries based on the schema defined,.or else deletes content from an LDIF file.
tFileOutputMSDelimited creates a complex multi-structured delimited file, using data structures (schemas) coming from several incoming Row flows.
tFileOutputMSPositional creates a complex multi-structured file, using data structures (schemas) coming from several incoming Row flows.
tFileOutputMSXML creates a complex multi-structured XML file, using data structures (schemas) coming from several incoming Row flows.
It writes a file row by row, according to the data structure (schema) coming from the input flow.
tFileInputProperties writes a configuration file containing text data organized according to the model key = value.
tFileProperties obtains information about the main properties of a defined file.
tFileRowCount opens a file and reads it row by row in order to determine the number of rows inside.
This component creates an empty file, and creates the destination directory if it does not exist.
Decompresses an archive file for further processing. Such formats are supported: *.tar.gz , *.tgz, *.tar, *.gz and *.zip.
This component calls the gpg -d command to decrypt a GnuPG-encrypted file and saves the decrypted file in the specified directory.
This component is used to close a named-pipe at the end of a process.
This component is used in inner-process communication, it opens a named-pipe for writing data into it.
This component allows you to write data into an existing open named-pipe.
tPivotToColumnsDelimited is used to fine-tune the selection of data to output
tFSAggregate helps setting metrics and statistics based on values or calculations from one or several large scale files.
tFSCheck helps ensure the quality of data in a source file according to a sort type and order.
tFSCode allows you to design FileScale components which are adaptable to your specific needs and fulfil domain-specific tasks.
Helps homogenizing schemas in a file either by removing unwanted columns or adding new ones.
Helps parametrizing row filters for large scale source data against set conditions.
Helps combining a leftset file with a rightset file using a join predicate in order to identify the data on which to perform the join.
Helps partitioning mass data before writing it in an output file.
tFSSort helps creating metrics and classification tables.
FSTransform helps transforming columns in large scale files.
tFSUnique helps having the output file without any duplicate records.
tFileFetch allows you to retrieve file data according to the protocol which is in place.
tFTPConnection allows you to open an FTP connection to transfer files in a single transaction.
tFTPDelete deletes files on a remote FTP server.
tFTPFileExist allows you to check if a file exists on an FTP server.
tFTPFileList retrieves files and /or folders based on a defined filemask pattern and iterates on each of them by connecting to a remote directory via an FTP protocol.
tFTPFileProperties retrieves files and /or folders based on a defined filemask pattern and iterates on each of them by connecting to a remote directory via an FTP protocol.
tFTPGet retrieves selected files from a defined remote FTP directory and cop them to a local directory.
tFTPPut copies selected files from a defined local directory to a destination remote FTP directory.
tFTPRename renames files selected from a local directory towards a distant FTP directory.
tFTPTruncate truncates the selected files of a defined local directory via a distant FTP directory.
The tHttpRequest component allows you to send an HTTP request to the server and output the response information locally.
tJBossESBInput makes it possible to pass JBossESB message to a Talend Job.
tJBossESBOutput makes it possible to pass the data in a Talend Job to a JBossESB message.
Using a JMS server, tJMSInput makes it possible to have loosely coupled, reliable, and asynchronous communication between different components in a distributed application.
Using a JMS server, tJMSOutput makes it possible to have loosely coupled, reliable, and asynchronous communication between different components in a distributed application.
This component allows you to fetch messages one by one in the ID sequence of these messages from the Microsoft message queue. Each execution retrieves only one message.
This component makes it possible to write messages to Microsoft message queue.
Using a unique connection, this component commits in one go a global transaction instead of doing that on every row or every batch and thus provides gain in performance.
This component opens a connection to the MQ Server for communication.
tMomInput makes it possible to set up asynchronous communications via a MOM server.
tMomMessageIdList makes it possible to iterate on certain message IDs. It is usually used with tMomInput, for more information, see .
tMomOutput makes it possible to set up asynchronous communications via a MOM server.
Avoids involuntary commitment of part of a transaction.
tPetalsInput makes it possible to pass Petals data to a Talend Job.
tPetalsOutput makes it possible to pass the data in a Talend Job to Petals data.

The tPOP component uses the POP or IMAP protocol to connect to a specific email server. Then it fetches one or more email messages and writes the recovered information in specified files. Parameters in the Advanced settings view allows you to use filters on your selection.
The tREST component serves as a REST Web service client that sends HTTP requests to a REST Web service provider and gets the responses.
tRSSInput makes it possible to keep track of blog entries on websites to gather and organize information for quick and easy access.
tRSSOutput makes it possible to create XML files that hold RSS or Atom feeds.
This component closes a connection to an SCP protocol.
tSCPConnection allows you to open an SCP connection to transfer files in one transaction.
tSCPDelete allows you to remove a file from the defined SCP server.
tSCPFileExists allows you to verify the existence of a file on the defined SCP server.
tSCPFileList allows you to list files from the defined SCP server.
tSCPGet allows you to copy files from the defined SCP server.
tSCPPut allows you to copy files to the defined SCP server.
tSCPRename allows you to rename file(s) on the defined SCP server.
tSCPTruncate allows you to remove data from file(s) on the defined SCP server.
tSendMail purpose is to notify recipients about a particular state of a Job or possible errors.
tSetKerberosConfiguration allows you to enter the relevant information for Kerberos authentication.
This component allows you to set the authentication data type between PKCS 12 and JKS.
tSetProxy allows you to enter the relevant information for proxy setup.
tSocketInput component is a listening component, allowing to pass data via a defined port
tSocketOutput sends out the data from the incoming flow to listening socket port.
This component calls a method via a Web service in order to retrieve the values of the parameters defined in the component editor.
This component calls a method via a Web service in order to retrieve the values of the parameters defined in the component editor.
Invokes a Method through a Web service.
Invokes a Method through a Web service and for the described purpose
Generates the boolean evaluation on the concern for the Job execution status. The status includes:
Generates a data flow consolidating the status information of a job execution and transfer the data into defined output files.
Operates as a chronometer device that starts calculating the processing time of one or more subjobs in the main Job, or that starts calculating the processing time of part of your subjob.
Operates as a chronometer device that stops calculating the processing time of one or more subjobs in the main Job, or that stops calculating the processing time of part of your subjob.
Triggers the tLogCatcher component for exhaustive log before killing the Job.
The number of rows is then meant to be caught by the tFlowMeterCatcher for logging purpose.
Operates as a log function triggered by the use of a tFlowMeter component in the Job.
Operates as a log function triggered by one of the three: Java exception, tDie or tWarn, to collect and transfer log data.
tLogRow is used to monitor data processed.
Operates as a log function triggered by the StatsCatcher Statistics check box of individual components, and collects and transfers this log data to the output defined.
Triggers a warning often caught by the tLogCatcher component for exhaustive log.

tAddLocationFromIP helps you to geolocate visitors through their IP addresses. It identifies visitors geographical locations i.e. country, region, city, latitude, longitude, ZIP code...etc.using an IP address lookup database file.
The tBufferInput component retrieves data bufferized via a tBufferOutput component, for example, to process it in another subjob.

This component allows a Webservice to access data. Indeed it had been designed to be exported as Webservice in order to access data on the web application server directly. For more information, see Talend Data Integration Studio User Guide.

tContextDump can be used to transform the current context parameters into a flow that can then be used in a tContextLoad. This feature is very convenient in order to define once only the context and be able to reuse it in numerous Jobs via the tContextLoad.
tContextLoad can be used to load a context from a flow.
tFixedFlowInput allows you to generate fixed flow from internal variables.
tMemorizeRows memorizes a sequence of rows that pass this component and then allows its following component(s) to perform operations of your interest on the memorized rows.
tMsgBox is a graphical break in the job execution progress.
Can be used to create an input flow in a Job for testing purposes, in particular for boundary test sets
This component feeds the parallel execution processes with the threads generated by tPartitioner.
This component assembles the outputs of the parallel execution processes so that tRecollector can capture those outputs.
This component is used to read data line by line from the input flow and store the data entries in iterative global variables.
tForeach allows you to to create a loop on a list for an iterate link.
tInfiniteLoop allows you to to execute a task or a Job automatically, based on a loop.
Allows you to transform non processable data into a processable flow.
tLoop allows you to execute a task or a Job automatically, based on a loop
tParallelize helps you manage complex Job systems. It executes several subjobs simultaneously and synchronizes the execution of a subjob with other sub-jobs within the main Job.
This component partitions the input data before tCollector can transfer them to the parallel execution processes.
tPostjob triggers a task required after the execution of a Job
tPrejob triggers a task required for the execution of a Job
Depending on tDepartitioner, the tRecollector component enables the output of the parallel execution results.
Allows you to perform different operations on the same schema.

Allows you to identify possible bottlenecks using a time break in the Job for testing or tracking purpose. In production, it can be used for any needed pause in the Job to feed input flow for example.
Centralize data from various and heterogeneous sources.
This component allows a subjob to be triggered given a condition linked to file presence or removal.
This component triggers a Job based on a defined condition.
This component allows a subjob to be triggered given a condition linked to sql data presence.
Helps to provide a set of metrics based on values or calculations.
Helps to provide a set of metrics based on values or calculations. As the input flow is meant to be sorted already, the performance are hence greatly optimized.
tBRMS applies Drools business rules to an incoming flow and writes the output data to an XML file.
Helps to automatically convert one Talend java type to another and thus.avoid compiling errors.
tDenormalize helps synthesize the input flow.
tDenormalizeSortedRow helps synthesizing sorted input flow to save memory.
Helps create metrics and classification table.
tExtractDelimitedFields helps to extract fields from within a string to write them elsewhere for example.
tExtractDynamicFields allows you to parse a Dynamic column to create standard output columns.
tExtractEBCDICFields allows you to use regular expressions to extract data from a formatted string.

tExtractEDIField opens an input EDIFACT message file, reads the EDI structured data directly without having to write it out to a temporary file first, extracts data through XPATH queries, and finally sends the data to the next component via a Row connection.
tExtractPositionalFields allows you to use a positional pattern to extract data from a formatted string.
tExtractRegexFields allows you to use regular expressions to extract data from a formatted string.
Helps homogenize schemas either on the columns order or by removing unwanted columns or adding new columns.
tFilterRow helps parametrizing filters on the source data.
This component helps you ensure the data quality of any source data against a reference data source.
tMap transforms and routes data from single or multiple sources to single or multiple destinations.
tNormalize helps improve data quality and thus eases the data update.
Helps to cleanse all files before further processing.
tRules allows you to use business rules defined in a Drools file of .xls or .drl format in order to filter data.
tSampleRow helps to select rows according to a list of single lines and/or a list of groups of lines.
Helps creating metrics and classification table.
This component helps splitting one input row into several output rows.
tWriteDynamicFields allows you to create un dynamic schema from input columns in the component.
tWriteJSONField reads data from an input file, assembles it into JSON objects and outputs them to the defined field of an output file.
tXMLMap transforms and routes data from single or multiple sources to single or multiple destinations.
tRunJob helps mastering complex Job systems which need to execute one Job after another.

tSetEnv allows to create variables and execute a Job script through communicating the information about the newly created variables between subjobs. After job execution, the newly created variables are deleted.
Allows to establish a communication with distant server and return securely sensible information.
tSystem can call other processing commands, already up and running in a larger Job.
This component uses bulk mode to write data so that big batches of data or data of high complexity can be fast uploaded onto the MDM server.
This component is used to terminate an opened MDM server connection after the execution of the proceeding subjob.
This component is used to open a connection to an MDM server for convenient reuse in the subsequent subjob or subjobs.
This component deletes master data in an MDM hub.
This component reads master data in an MDM Hub and thus makes it possible to process this data.
This component writes master data on the MDM server.
This component decodes a context parameter holding MDM XML data and transforms it into a flat schema.
This component helps Event Manager identify the changes which you have made on your data so that correlative actions can be triggered.
tMDMSP offers a convenient way to centralize multiple or complex queries in a MDM Hub and call them easily.

Every time when you save a change in your MDM, the corresponding change record is generated in XML format. At runtime, this component reads this record and sends the relative information to the following component.

This component receives an XML flow to set the MDM message so that MDM retrieves this message at runtime. With this component, you do not need to configure your Job any more in order to communicate the data changes from MDM to your Job.
This component allows you to retrieve the MDM records from an MDM hub.
This component helps streamline processes by removing tasks that are no longer used or relevant.

This component reads data in the datastewardship console and thus makes it possible to process this data, i.e. to use any Talend output component and write the data retrieved from the stewardship database into the target application or database.
This component create tasks in the Talend Data Stewardship Console database and lists these tasks in the stewardship console.
This component reads from the cache memory data loaded by tHashOutput to offer high-speed data feed, facilitating transactions involving a large amount of data.
This component loads data to the cache memory to offer high-speed access, facilitating transactions involving a large amount of data.
tAdvancedFileOutputXML writes an XML file with separated data values according to an XML tree structure.
Helps at controlling data and structure quality of the file to be processed
This component is used to transform an EDIFACT message file into the XML format for better readability to users and compatibility with processing tools.

tExtractXMLField opens an input XML field, reads the XML structured data directly without having first to write it out to a temporary file, and finally sends data as defined in the schema to the following component via a Row link.
Opens an XML structured file and reads it row by row to split them up into fields then sends fields as defined in the Schema to the next component, via a Row link.
tFileOutputXML writes an XML file with separated data value according to a defined schema.
tWriteXMLField reads an input XML file and extracts the structure to insert it in defined fields of the output file.
Helps at controlling data and structure quality of the file or flow to be processed
Helps to transform data structure to another structure.
